moves.1. e4: I started with my usual kings pawn move that I use when playing white.
moves.1... d6 2. Nc3 Nf6 3. d3: Defending the king's pawn against a possible attack with the pawn at d6
moves.3... g6 4. Bg5: Let's keep an eye on the knight
moves.4... Bg7 5. Bxf6: I thought I would use the bishop for a future pin but decided to trade it
moves.5... exf6: I would probably have used the bishop to recapture here
moves.6. Nge2 O-O 7. f3 Re8 8. Qd2: Looking to break into the castle somehow...
moves.8... f5 9. h4 fxe4 10. dxe4 Nc6 11. a3: Prepare for a king and rook fork
moves.12... Bc4 13. h6 Bf6 14. b3 Bxe2 15. Bxe: Good move. wasting my castling opportunity
moves.16. g3: This was a big mistake. I cannot record what was in my mind.
I had to distrurb the queen since moving his night to f3 could have been devastating.
moves.19... Qe5: Fortunately now there was my chace to counter attak with the queen threat gone.....
moves.20... Bf4: Of course, this aimed to give him some time, but the take could not be avoided.
moves.23. Bd1: Started a small cat and mouse game
Now we need to improve our position...
moves.28. Qa5: But backrank is quite open and we could go for a striking mate
moves.28... Nc6: Very wise. guarding the backrank and also trying to force the queen away
moves.29... f5: Making room for his king escape....mandatory
moves.30... Qd4: Now it's his turn to try the mate. One move could end it up, but.....
moves.31. Qe8#: Moving the queen away from the e file gives me room for checkmating. I wish I could play like this in the rated games :).
